intro: Lellingeria randallii, commonly known as the Randall's lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Lellingeria randallii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
